zygisk.description: Firstly, make sure you are using a kernel that supports KernelSU (See TWRP tab).\nMost modules require Zygisk, so you should install ZygiskNext and Zygisk Hider (See Modules tab)\nIf an app requires SU, open the KernelSU application, and enable root access within the app section.
zygisk.heading: How do I use module?

zygisk_hider.brief: Module for hiding the traces of Zygisk
zygisk_hider.description: Firstly, make sure you are using a kernel that supports KernelSU (See TWRP tab).\nMost modules require Zygisk, so you should install ZygiskNext and Zygisk Hider (See Modules tab)\nIf an app requires SU, open the KernelSU application, and enable root access within the app section.
zygisk_hider.heading: How do I use module?

viper4android_re.brief: Module for using Viper4Android on Android
viper4android_re.description: Firstly, make sure you are using a kernel that supports KernelSU (See TWRP tab).\nMost modules require Zygisk, so you should install ZygiskNext and Zygisk Hider (See Modules tab)\nIf an app requires SU, open the KernelSU application, and enable root access within the app section.
viper4android_re.heading: How do I use this module?

lsposed.brief: Zygisk module for using LSPosed with KernelSU
lsposed.description: Firstly, make sure you are using a kernel that supports KernelSU (See TWRP tab).\nMost modules require Zygisk, so you should install ZygiskNext and Zygisk Hider (See Modules tab)\nIf an app requires SU, open the KernelSU application, and enable root access within the app section.

lsposed_traces_hider.brief: A kernel-based root solution for Android.
lsposed_traces_hider.description: Firstly, make sure you are using a kernel that supports KernelSU (See TWRP tab).\nMost modules require Zygisk, so you should install ZygiskNext and Zygisk Hider (See Modules tab)\nIf an app requires SU, open the KernelSU application, and enable root access within the app section.

items.youtube_revanced_ex: Use Youtube Revenced Extended with this module. Firstly, make sure you are using a kernel that supports KernelSU (See TWRP tab).\nMost modules require Zygisk, so you should install ZygiskNext and Zygisk Hider (See Modules tab)\nIf an app requires SU, open the KernelSU application, and enable root access within the app section.
